lines.text: Most materials expand with increased temperature
Different materials expand at different rates
Water contracts and sinks as it cools, until 4°C
From 4°C to 0°C, water expands and stays on top
Then ice forms on top and floats

secText:
Lesson:
1. Define [OBJ:expsec_k492:thermal expansion].
2. Define [OBJ:expsec_k493:linear thermal expansion].
3. Calculate [OBJ:expsec_k496:linear thermal expansion].
4. Work through a sample problem to [OBJ:app_thermal_expansion_question:calculate the linear thermal expansion] of a rod.
5. Define and calculate [OBJ:expsec_k494:thermal volume expansion].
6. [OBJ:expsec_k495:Explain] the thermal volume expansion of water.

In-class assessment:
1. [OBJ:qc_37462:Calculate] the linear thermal expansion of a copper rod.
2. [OBJ:qc_37463:Calculate] the thermal volume expansion of water.
